citation.article-title: Description of Caldicellulosiruptor saccharolyticus gen. nov., sp. nov: an obligately anaerobic, extremely thermophilic, cellulolytic bacterium.

p.s: Caldicellulosiruptor ((cal. di. eel. lu. lo. si. rup' tor) L. adj. caldus hot; N.L. cellulosum cellulose; L. mas. n. ruptor breaker; N. L. mas. n. Caldicellulosiruptor a bacterium that breaks up hot cellulose, because the taxon degrades cellulose under thermophilic conditions)
Growth not obtained after heat treatment at 115°C for 20 min.
Growth strictly anaerobic, occurring over the temperature range 45-80°C with an optimum of 70°C.
No growth detected below 45°C or above 80°C.
Monosaccharides, disaccharides and polysaccharides serve as fermentable substrates.
Growth not detected in the absence of fermentable carbon source.
Cellulose is hydrolysed and serves as a sole carbon source.
Strain Tp8T 6331 represents a novel lineage within the Bacillus/Clostridium subphylum of the Gram-positive
bacteria based on 16S rRNA sequence data.
The type species is Caldicellulosiruptor saccharolyticus.
